required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of PCSK9 Inhibitor AK102 in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A First-in-Human,Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Single Dose Escalation,Phase 1 Study to Evaluate the Safety,Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of AK102 in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This is a first-in-human,randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, single dose escalation, phase 1 study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, PK/PD and immunogenicity of AK102 administered subcutaneously in healthy subjects. Subjects will be randomized into 4 planned single dose escalation cohorts or placebo cohort.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From single dose of AK102 through 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product temporally associated with the use of study treatment, whether or not considered related to the study treatment.

secondary_outcome.description: Serum concentrations of AK102 at different timepoints before and after AK102 single dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Low-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At different time points from baseline through 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Low-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C) blood concentrations before and after AK102 single dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in PCSK9
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At different time points from baseline through 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: PCSK9 blood concentrations before and after AK102 single dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects who develop detectable anti-drug antibodies (ADAs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At different time points from baseline through 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of AK102 will be assessed by summarizing the number of subjects who develop detectable ADAs.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed Informed Consent.
- No clinically significant abnormalities judged by the principal investigator based on the medical history, physical examination, electrocardiogram and routine laboratory evaluations.
- Low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) level of 70-190 mg/dL (inclusive).
- Body mass index (BMI) ≥18 and ≤ 28 kg/m^2 , body weight >= 50 kg for male or >= 45 kg for female.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Triglyceride concentration >400 mg/dL (4.5 mmol/L).
- History of hypersensitivity reactions to any substance of the investigation drug or other monoclonal antibodies.
- Drug or alcohol abuse within 6 months prior to dosing.
- Blood pressure >140 mmHg (systolic) or > 90 mmHg (diastolic)
